intro: Leucas deflexa var. kondowensis, commonly known as the Kondow's leucas, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale blue or violet, arranged in whorled clusters along the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
